intro: Nemophila rotata var. incana, commonly known as the silverleaf fairybell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The leaves are typically covered in a fine, silvery-gray coating, which gives the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun, often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. This plant is known for its short blooming period in early spring, adding a touch of delicate beauty to its native environment.
